posts.com:
The muscle in pic (big toe retraction muscle which runs along the inner foot) undergoes very tight and painful cramps which last about 30-60 seconds. This happens at least once or twice a week. posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I've had this for years. Not uncommon for it to wake me up in the middle of the night. Two things keep mine in check:

1. Have enough salt / keep electrolytes in check if exercising
2. Keep feet warm in winter. Both of mine cramp like a bastard when cold.

>>69765801
Been on it about a year now, the only side effect I had was for the first few months I was getting erections like I was a teenager again, it was fucking annoying. Looked into it and yeah, fin can either cause ED or actually boost libido since it increases your testosterone levels by inhibiting its conversion to DHT.

The other side effect, if you can call it that, is that I pee less often than I used to, but pee more out when I do. I'm gonna attribute this to the fact that finasteride was originally developed to deal with enlarged prostates, which is primarily caused by excess DHT production. Chances are if you suffer from androgenic alopecia that you also have an enlarged prostate squeezing on your bladder. Enlarged prostates can also exacerbate your chances of developing prostate cancer later in life. So if you're going bald be extra sure to have your prostate examined, your chances of developing prostate cancer are higher than men who still have hair (but men with no balding issues should get checked anyways).

It's actually been observed in studies that men with androgenic alopecia who take finasteride have a lower rate of developing prostate cancer and heart disease than those who don't. But if you do take finasteride make sure to tell the doctor you do when you get your prostate examined, because your prostate will have shrunk and they might miss something unless you let them know ahead of time.

That's the thing, we're a very closed off and somewhat hidden away community, and we're not very welcoming to newcomers. Also, other than namefagging (which is thankfully very frowned upon) there's no real way to build clout on this site, which is something that has been indoctrinated as a value in gen Z by corporate woke-fascism.

4chan and other sites like it are inherently antithetical to that contemporary online value system. You can't get megafamous off the chan sites, you can't really make a lot of money off of them either. Sites like 4chan are the last of an old guard of the internet, made during the days when the techno-libertarians who built the internet in the 80s and 90s naively thought that the internet would be a tool of liberation, rather than the weapon of neoliberal decadence, surveillance, division and suppression it has grown into.

This system of anonymous posting is a double-edged sword, we can never compete with the likes of modern social media sites like TikTok, but the very nature of this site allows for some incredible creativity to flow (think about how many trends have started and still do start from 4chan). Hell, greenposts still reach far and wide to this day (in much the same way tweets do), so 4chan still has its reach. But I know in my heart our days are numbered, this website will surely die since it failed to reach the next generation, but perhaps that's for the best. It would have to principally change to survive, and then it would lose what makes 4chan unique.

Such is life.

Physical output. That’s the only thing that worked for me. You need to exhaust yourself everyday. On “rest” days either go to a park, your neighborhood or if neither are applicable, the gym, and walk for an hour at least, at a high rate. >rep ranges like 3x10 are not particularly good for hypertrophy because of sandbagging, rep ranges like 3x8-12 are much better. however, the fewer sets you do, the less flawed static rep ranges are, for example there is no sandbagging at all with 1x5, but 5x5 will result in a lot of sandbagging

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>69762526
Gn bro
>>69762572
>I'd like to add either hammer curls or finger curls, which one would be better in your opinion?
Probably finger curls for now since you're already doing reverse curls, however hammer curls are very easy to program in your training so you could figure out a slot for them once you've had the finger curls in for a while.
>>69762613
Not using your full effort, in this case you cannot go to failure (or even 1-2 RIR in some cases) on the first set because you wouldn't be able to hit the same amount of reps on the later sets due to fatigue, so you have to stop multiple reps from failure on the first set to prevent that from happening, which isn't what you want. Even if you don't intend on going to failure anyway this still causes the intensity on each set to be different as the later sets will be closer to failure than the earlier ones, while with a rep range you can keep the amount of reps in reserve about the same on each set.

Now, sandbagging isn't inherently bad if you're doing it intentionally, but static rep ranges force you to unintentionally sandbag, which is obviously bad.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>69766009
>Please redpill on the rows causing hernias meme
Assuming you're talking about barbell rows, it's definitely a meme. Now the chance of injuring your back doing cheat rows instead of normal bb rows is definitely higher, but cheat rows aren't worth it IMO due to the fatigue cost (+ tracking progression is annoying). If you do much stricter BB rows (no using the lower back or hips to move the weight, controlled eccentric, and performed off of a deficit ideally. Also higher rep range) the chances of a back injury are pretty much nonexistent, so if you're scared of injuring your back you should do those instead. And for extra insurance, do your back extensions and RDLs for strong erectors, and optionally jefferson curls so that your spine becomes acclimated to flexion under load. Those should reduce the injury risk even further.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>69766009
Also forgot to mention, if you're talking about db rows then I'm not too sure as I don't do them personally but I know some people use a staggered stance instead of one knee on a bench for that reason. But idk how much it really matters desu, only way I can see someone getting a hernia doing that is if they're egolifting and using a ton of spinal rotation to move the weight instead of actually using their back muscles. Just don't egolift, and if you want to be extra sure use a staggered stance instead of one leg on the bench.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>69760996
Neither for those "undertrains" or "overtrains" you. It's about weekly total volume at different intensity thresholds.
U/L is harder to overshoot with because the sessions turn into 2h+ if you go apeshit with the volume and exercise selection on upper days.
Start with 6-20 working sets for each muscle group each week, on the low spectrum. I hit arms and delts towards the upper end of that for high frequency, while legs are 8-12 working sets per week because I am progressing with that and I still get sore as fuck.

I ran U/L, now I run some morphed x2 freqency brosplit because doing back and especially rows on the day before squats/diddly didn't agree with me. It doesn't matter, your split is just convenience and preference, what matters is total volume and intensity which is something you have to figure out for yourself.

>sun - same as monday

posts.com:
Been on keto for 30 days now, though I’m not doing therapeutic keto as my macros can range from 55-75 fat and 30-45 protein. Didn’t have any problems transitioning and it helped that I’ve been doing a 36hr fasts for a year or so I think the body knows what to do.
It’s insane how after you’re adjusted you have to force yourself to eat, or that’s my case anyways. Rarely feel hunger, just know I need to eat, and hitting even 1500 can be difficult. Idgaf about cutting sugars and shit totally, I have a decent amount of cheese and treat myself with 1 almond cookie and some milk at least twice a week. Only exercising 3 days a week and one 36hr fast in the week, tho I intend to change and get cardio every day now that I’ve got my energy.
Despite my lackluster effort in this I’m losing weight and easily. Also gaining muscle 100%, was DYEL before this. Should be tape measuring myself but I’ve lost 11lbs while upper body has gotten muscular.
I’d recommend anyone that wants to get into fasting even for a day be in a toxic relationship with a woman with an ED. I learned to ignore hunger pains years ago from being with her and it finally is serving me a purpose.
As far headaches and all that shit that comes with like 36+ hr fasts, I say unless you’re morbidly obese you’d be better off splitting 2 36hr instead of 72hr or something ridic. Personally when I start to get a headache it won’t go away if fasting so I never try multi day shit.

TL,DR; Get LMNT non flavored or chocolate blend electrolyte mixes. Yes, the chocolate blends have a 1g of carbs. No, it won’t ruin your entire fast.
We all gonna make it boys

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Gwurf edition

>Who is /fat/ for?
For fatties who are working towards a better physique through meaningful hard-work, strategy, and dedication. This is not QTDDTOT, stick to questions on fat loss. Post height and weight when asking for advice.
Join our Fatty Contest: https://www.fattycontest.com/

>What do I do first?
1. Read https://physiqonomics.com/fat-loss/
2. Calculate your Body Fat Percentage: https://fitness.bizcalcs.com/Calculator.asp?Calc=Body-Fat-Navy
3. Calculate your TDEE: https://www.sailrabbit.com/bmr/
Remember to use bodyfat% and use Katch-McArdle Formula with sedentary settings or your TDEE will be too high.
4. Plan your weight loss: https://www.losertown.org/eats/cal.php
5. Track your nutrition with MyFitnessPal (better for packaged food), Cronometer (better for generic food/macros) or LoseIt (great for both).

>Now what?
Count calories, all of them.
Eat about 500-1000 less calories than your TDEE.
Buy scales, be accurate.
Learn to cook. Try to stick to lean protein and green vegetables.
Eat a lot of protein. 0.72g per lb of goal lean body mass.
Doing cardio, even just walking, will improve your health. There is no such thing as a healthy fat heart, but you can offset the risks.
Lifting weights will keep and gain muscle mass and burn fat much quicker. No lifting results in the body burning away muscle AND fat.
Drink more water.
Read the /fit/ sticky: https://liamrosen.com/fitness.html

>DON'T
Eat refined sugars, they're terrible for you regardless of calories.
Eat processed foods.
Drink your calories (alcohol, soda, starbucks).
Freak out over a weight loss stall. Plateaus can last up to three weeks.
"Reward" yourself. Cheat days cheat only yourself.

>Other resources:
Loose skin, gyno & stretch marks: https://weight-loss-side-effects.netlify.app/
Reddit wiki: https://www.reddit.com/r/loseit/wiki/faq

>>69753338
Started at 100kg around 3 months ago.
Fixed my diet starting from cutting coke and other sodas, stopped frying foods etc.
Later started lifting a bit (for chest mostly, once every 3rd day), and going for a long walks (12km +/-) pretty often.
Switched almost eclusively to natural foods that I cook myself, and drink only black coffe, tea (without sugar etc.), water. Once a week I have some kind of fast food, like kebab - still fit it in my kcal deficit though, no pigging out, or taking 3000kcal in a day.
I lost most of my fat, my face improved, I thought I had gyno for sure - today I am almost certainly sure it was just fat because they look normal (a bit puffy nipples but w/e).
I weighted myself today and saw 85kg on one scale, and 84.7 on another, (I am 198cm, 23 y.o.) this is insanely nice to see that I am making it. My goal now is to hit 80kg and go to get my bf% checked (there is a dietician near me that does first one for free), and figure out what to do then. I don't wanna go skelly mode, but I wanna be just slim with a subtle showing of muscles - then as I get older I plan to get more muscular.

The best feeling is wearing a shirt that was showing Your belly few months ago, and now it is hanging on You, when You put on pants and need to tighten Your belt so they don't fall off. I am intentionally pulling out old t-shirts and wearing them as a badge of honor because they fit me now.
Nothing tastes as good, as skinny feels.
WAGMI

>>69759338
Your body breaks protein down in to carbs when it has excess protein available. Hence why protein is 4kcal per gram, as are carbs.

That said, if you already have carbs/sugar available in your bloodstream, your body will burn those instead, it may even burn fat reserves over protein idk you'd have to speak to a proper nutritionist. But said protein will just then be broken down in the future if it isn't used to repair muscle fibres from lifting etc. So if you're working out often and ensuring that your muscles are getting sufficient stress, in theory higher levels of protein should help you stay leaner.

>bodybuilders and strongmen in their 40s are perfectly healthy from pulling 3-4pl8s regularly and don't any problems with their spines
If they're egolifting and are not using appropriate load management then of course they're going to get problems. But if you do things correctly you won't have any issues. I fucked up my back ego-lifting when I was dyel, I fixed it with back extensions and more direct ab work and now I can do whatever exercises I want with no issues. I still get some pain from spinal flexion but I've been working on jefferson curls and it has lessened significantly, so in the future I'll probably be able to load up a good bit on the jefferson curl without any pain at all. And once I get to that point the chance of me injuring myself on squats or whatever will be significantly lessened, because even if I do an incredibly shitty rep with a lot of spine rounding, my spine will probably be fine because it would be acclimated to being in a flexed position under load so my chance of injury would be extremely low even in those circumstances

>>69765558
CICO is ultimately true but there are a few variables to deal with.

As your body sheds fat and muscle, your maintenance calories goes down. Your metabolism will also slow down in order to conserve energy, which will lower your maintenance calories further.

Basically you need to eat less and less to lose the same amount of weight, and while this sounds obvious, it can be very difficult. There is a hormone called leptin that makes you feel hungry, and it is partially affected by how physically full your stomach is - the less food in there, the more leptin your body will produce.

So you not only have to eat less calories but now you are hungrier than before. It can be a real mental challenge.

My recommendation is to eat a bit more food and offset the calories with cardio. It will help you with your sanity. You should also be taking casein protein every time you feel unbearably hungry

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>69763193

Unfortunately you're cursed with that for the rest of your life. I struggle with the same thing and its worse than yours. You best come to terms with that and not let it ruin your confidence and life. Get swole, there's not much you can do and under certain harsh lighting it's terrible.

Cheapest way to improve is prescribed tretinoin 0.1% or stronger and rotate derma stamping(not rolling as those rollers drag skin and cause further scarring) and tca peels(must purchase from foreign websites). You'll start to see improvements after 1 year, 5+ years for some results. Take collagen peptide supps; there's no science proving that they work yet I do notice a difference.

Aztec clay masks help reduce their appearance temporarily from the tightening of the skin. I use porefessional pore eraser primer makeup to fill in the large gaps and it helps a little bit. You gotta push the product into the dents. Moisturize. Plump and well moisturized skin reduce their appearance but don't use any products that are shiny or give glow, must use matte.

If you really want to treat it, you can go the surgery route. Subcision with suction method to detach the anchored scar tissue and prevent it from reattaching(highly likely, need 5+ sessions). Be careful though as if you scar easily it may make it even worse. Fillers to replace the voids and collapse of collagen. Tca cross to fill those indents and raise the scars.

Lasers are a waste of money as it only treats the superficial level of skin and is only to be done after you fixed the underlying tethered scar tissue.

The most effective solution that will reduce their appearance is the phenol peel. But there are only a few doctors in the U.S. who does it properly and it costs $12k and 2 days and your face will be red as a tomato for 6 months. It will get rid of most of the superficial scars and reduce pore sizes and improve texture.

>>69751955
You don't have to take rest days if you rotate your muscle groups - instead of skipping the machine for a specific sore muscle, divide your days to lower body/upper body days, some use the division of push/pull days etc. Then you can lift for days in a row, each time working some muscles while others are resting.

Start gradually, don't burn yourself over the first week of exercise, you won't be able to keep it up (maybe in your teens or very early twenties). It's better to start with 2-3 weight workouts in the first week, and add more days as you progress. Cardio you can do more, especially if it's light, you can do it every day with or without the weight training.

Make sure to eat a lot of protein, drink lots of water, sleep at least 8 hours and move around during the day (walk, dance, stretch) instead of sitting. This will help with the soreness and would increase your performances.

Pudding originally was another name for sausage (same root word as the creole word boudan), and came to eventually mean anything steamed or boiled in a wrapper, before diverging to mean a boiled starch dessert in the US (like a pudding cup) or literally any dessert in the UK. posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>69760123
>https://recordinglaw.com/party-two-party-consent-states/florida-recording-laws/

Technically, if you're in your own home no one can record you without your consent, or any other space you have an expectation of privacy.
Businesses simply have to post a sign that it's patrons have a reasonable expectation of privacy on premises and all recording on that premises (except for the businesses CCTV security) is illegal.
The real trick is creating a situation in public where you can argue you had a reasonable expectation of privacy.
One possible scenario is talking to someone in public, but in a low tone, and away from others, or in a huge crowd where your voices are drowned out. You can argue you were having a private conversation even though it was in public, since you took the effort to keep the conversation just between you and the other person. In that instance, if someone records that conversation, that would would be considered a crime.
At least in Florida.

This privacy shit is a big deal because without any protections in place we are hurdling full steam to a hivemind enslavement reality.
